issue.title: New OQS breaks the build
issue.body:
Latest OQS update breaks the OpenSSL build. "./config" results in the following error:

cd vendor/liboqs && make links
make[1]: Entering directory '/mnt/c/temp/openssl/vendor/liboqs'
make[1]: *** No rule to make target 'links'.  Stop.
make[1]: Leaving directory '/mnt/c/temp/openssl/vendor/liboqs'
Makefile:451: recipe for target 'links' failed
make: *** [links] Error 2

The config script shouldn't be "making" vendor/liboqs. This is currently done in "make".

comment.body:
As far as I can see this problem exists in the main (OpenSSL_1_0_2-stable)
branch too.

It's happening because Makeifle doesn't exist under vendor/liboqs because
autoreconf is  not called.
It gets called when make is called.

On Wed, Oct 4, 2017 at 9:34 PM, Christian Paquin <notifications@github.com>
wrote:

> Latest OQS update breaks the OpenSSL build. "./config" results in the
> following error:
>
> cd vendor/liboqs && make links
> make[1]: Entering directory '/mnt/c/temp/openssl/vendor/liboqs'
> make[1]: *** No rule to make target 'links'. Stop.
> make[1]: Leaving directory '/mnt/c/temp/openssl/vendor/liboqs'
> Makefile:451: recipe for target 'links' failed
> make: *** [links] Error 2
>
> The config script shouldn't be "making" vendor/liboqs. This is currently
> done in "make".
>
> —
> You are receiving this because you are subscribed to this thread.
> Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub
> <https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/openssl/issues/12>, or mute the
> thread

issue.body:
Latest OQS update breaks the OpenSSL build. "./config" results in the following error:

Makefile:451: recipe for target 'links' failed

The config script shouldn't be "making" vendor/liboqs. This is currently done in "make".

comment.body:
I noticed. Do you see an easy fix? Put a dummy makefile in OQS or modify openssl's config script?

On Oct 5, 2017, at 9:09 AM, smashra <notifications@github.com<mailto:notifications@github.com>> wrote:

As far as I can see this problem exists in the main (OpenSSL_1_0_2-stable)
branch too.

It's happening because Makeifle doesn't exist under vendor/liboqs because

It gets called when make is called.
